introduction.p: Problems, particulary in-class problems, have come from several sources. I've attempted to identify any distinctive problems and the sources are listed here.

references.biblio: Doerr, A, and K. Levasseur, Applied Discrete Structures

David Pengelley, From Lecture to Active Learning: Rewards for All, and Is It Really So Difficult?, The College Math Journal, January 2020, 51 1, 1324, doi.org/10.1080/07468342.2020.1680228The idea of teaching in an active learning environment had been on my radar for a while and I'd experimented with some aspects of the format. This article was the final impetus for launching this project.
